website_summaries.verdict: A budget option with excellent sound for the money.
pros: Sleek design, full-metal construction, easy installation
cons: May give feedback when adjusting knobs

customer_reviews.title: Over and above the best the absolute best far better than best
customer_reviews.text: Planet audio is new to me but timeless in innovation and sound engineering. Each knob adjusts to the exact freq. you want adapted by screw driver, then knob and the knobs push in or recess. OMG 1-10 ITS A 2500
customer_reviews.author: Matthew, says....

customer_reviews.title: Bad product. Didn’t even turn on!
customer_reviews.text: I received this product upon on working on a build for my stereo system and it didn’t even work. I will never shop with these people again.
customer_reviews.author: Brandon

customer_reviews.title: Three Stars
customer_reviews.text: Not bad, not great... does what it's meant to do and for the price, gets the job done.
customer_reviews.author: NoPe

customer_reviews.title: Came in with anothe face to it it can be ...
customer_reviews.text: Came in with anothe face to it it can be silver or you can change the front panel for a black one that comes in the box as well
customer_reviews.author: William Villafane

customer_reviews.title: This is the 4th purchase of this little Gem. ...
customer_reviews.text: This is the 4th purchase of this little Gem. This time I am using it in my 2013 Hyndai Veloster. Replacing a Quantum QEQ6, not sure if the Quantum is up to the task, but i know the Planet will perform. My music is a bit lifeless with the Quantum, hoping the proven Planet PEQ15, with it's variable parametric versatility will help bring more dynamics to the installation. Could always be the factory radio being a bit lackluster, tho. People tend to bash Planet, but they always perform for me.
customer_reviews.author: Mike Palguta

customer_reviews.title: very nice piece of equipment
customer_reviews.text: very nice piece of equipment .it sounds excellent.I use it as part of a ham radio audio add up in conjunction with tc-helicon voice toner.
customer_reviews.author: xintaras dimitris

customer_reviews.title: not a TRUE five band preamp
customer_reviews.text: got this and haven't installed it yet. it came properly packaged and undamaged. looks really good. the only problem i have with it is there only four eq bands. the manual states that "the sub channel is effectively a fifth band". i have owned a couple of planet audio pieces and none of them are or do as they are advertised. a 1000watt amp with a 25amp fuse? 10" woofers that are rated at 350watts and when driven with good solid power,(not planet audio) sound dull and lifeless? my advice is this-if you can't afford any better than this, don't bother. PLANET AUDIO SUCKS
customer_reviews.author: rocknhard

customer_reviews.title: If you want quality don't buy this
customer_reviews.text: I am not happy with this EQ, I owned a older one about 5 years ago and it was a great help to my stereo, this one is crap and not worth the $30. first off the rca outputs have bleed through, sound from the rear channel gets into the front channel, second the lights don't always work. and third the inside is rusted, looks like some of the frame metal was ground down and a wire soldered on. get what you pay for now days, I got this as I had a older one same model and it worked great and is still working in my friends car.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel

customer_reviews.title: Nice product for higher end users.
customer_reviews.text: Works well but not intended to be used by the average car audio user. This thing is very touchy and kind of a pain to setup correctly. If you do not know what you are doing as far as freq boost and or gain controls as a middle point. Would not suggest this. Go with a pure graphic eq, parametric has a very high learning curve to get set up right.
customer_reviews.author: Justin Grosz

customer_reviews.title: After inspecting the pcb I found many bad solder joints
customer_reviews.text: Purchased to install in a build. Took more than 3 months to start the install. Well, got time to install the eq and the darn thing wouldn't work. Two channels where DOA. I tinkered with it for hours. After inspecting the pcb I found many bad solder joints. My buddy who just so happened to have another eq brought it over, we swapped them out and everything plays fine.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Exactly what I needed
customer_reviews.text: I have a fair amount of experience working with equalizers in professional sound systems. I wanted something that I could use to "tune" the frequency response of my car stereo system. I love the way I can adjust the center frequency for each knob. It gives me all the control I wanted, and now I'm very pleased with the sound in my car. My only complaint is the brightness of the blue LEDs. The angle of my dashboard lines the LEDs up for perfect blinding blue light right into my eyes. I'm going to have to it up and adjust the LEDs.
customer_reviews.author: Kelerg

customer_reviews.title: poor fit and finish
customer_reviews.text: Face plate does not align with the potentiometers and switch. Pot knobs are not aligned in the center as stated by others. I can live with knob off centered but off centered knob against the face plate is not acceptable.
customer_reviews.author: na kang

customer_reviews.title: A equalizer is a must-have
customer_reviews.text: Overall good. I knew to figure it out all the way I would have to get it hooked up. One catch others may notice. You can't use eq boost for sub frequencies if you use the sub x over output at the same time. My amp already has this, but if you boost 20 hz @ 18 db and use the sub on the rear out instead then those powerful low signals get sent to the mids and highs. You will need another amp with a high pass x over to stop those deep frequencies. Update, like others, this unit makes noise, especially low frequency rumbling at higher volume it becomes apparent.
customer_reviews.author: jaycee

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: love that it has dual inputs one for phone which jams now and the other for radio
customer_reviews.author: Pat

customer_reviews.title: Planet Audio is garbage...
customer_reviews.text: I bought this and it worked great for six weeks. For no apparent reason the sub output just stop workimg. This is the third and last planet audio product ill ever buy. I've also had problems out of their 3 way crossover.
customer_reviews.author: Tenacious

customer_reviews.title: ... about a month does the job so far so good
customer_reviews.text: Had it for about a month does the job so far so good
customer_reviews.author: Dave khan

product_meta.title: Planet Audio Half-DIN, Band Car Equalizer, Subwoofer Output with Adjustable Filter, Fixed Bands
product_meta.description:
Audio ConnectionsView larger HOW AN EQUALIZER IS USED
The Planet Audio PEQ15 parametric equalizer is a high-fidelity signal processor/preamplifier that allows you to control the relative levels within the audible frequency spectrum of a stereophonic system. It is intended for use in a car audio system which includes amplifiers in a signal path after the equalizer, and provides front, rear, and subwoofer low level outputs via RCA connectors.

SPECIFICATIONS
 * Front/Rear EQ center frequency ranges: Low (20-70 Hz); Low/Mid (150-400 Hz); Mid (1.5-4 kHz); High (4-20 kHz)
 * Sub channel EQ crossover range: 50 – 250Hz
 * Equalization range: +/- 18 dB (boost/cut)
 * Frequency response: 10 Hz – 50 kHz (+/- 1dB)
 * Signal to noise ratio: 110 dB (ref. 1V input)
 * THD: 0.005%
 * Channel separation: 82 dB (at 1kHz)
 * Output impedance: 50k Ohms
 * Power supply: 11-15V negative ground
 * Output voltage: 7V
 * Dimensions: (7.2” W x 3.8” D x 1.3” H)

Front Panel Controls and Key FeaturesView larger FRONT PANEL CONTROLS AND KEY FEATURES
 1.  Fader: Use this control to balance the sound level between front and rear speakers as desired.
 2.  Input Select (CD or AUX): This button permits you to select the equalizer input source. The unit features separate rear panel RCA inputs for in dash receiver such as a CD or another source such as a DVD player
 3. Master Volume Control: Use this to adjust the overall output volume level.
 4.  Subwoofer Crossover Frequency Selector: Use this control to select the highest frequency to be sent to the subwoofer channel. Choose a frequency between 50 Hz and 250 Hz.
 5.  Subwoofer Volume Control: Use the knob to set the volume level for the subwoofer channel.
 6.  Front/Rear Channel Center Frequency Selectors: Use these controls to select the center frequencies for boosting/cutting in the signal provided to the front and rear output channels. Frequency ranges for each control are Low (20-70 Hz); Low/Mid (150-400 Hz); Mid (1.5-4 kHz); High (4-20 kHz)
 7.  Front/Rear Channel Boost/Cut Controls: These knobs will set the desired amount of boost or cut (from -18 to +18 dB) for each of the frequency bands within the signal provided to the rear and front output channels.

Top Panel Controls and Key FeaturesView larger TOP PANEL CONTROLS AND KEY FEATURES
 1. Subwoofer Channel RCA Outputs
 2.  Front And Rear Channel RCA Outputs
 3.  CD And AUX Channel RCA Inputs
 4.  Power Connections: Please note that the PEQ15 has an automatic turn-on circuit, so that in addition to the (+) and ground connections, it is necessary for you to connect the REM terminal to the REM terminal on your head unit. 
 5. CD And AUX Channel Controls: Use these controls during setup to balance the gain for each of the two input sources.
feature_bullets: 5 Band Adjustment, Adjustable Center Frequencies on Each Band
SUB: 50-250 Hz, Low: 20-70 Hz, Low-Mid 150-400 Hz, MID: 1.5 KHz - 4 KHz, High: 4 KHz - 20 Khz
Dimensions: Depth 7.2” x Width 3.8” x Height 1.3”
